channel.title: [PI] compiler wont work for me - windows 7 - laptop
channel.description:
[code]The system cannot find the path specified. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
this is my problem. but what i dont understand is this..
my compiler [code]@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_3\bin\javac.exe" -d ./Class/ Java/*.java Java/sign/*.java pause[/code]
thats my proper jdk... i have (x86) for my windows 7.. and i still get the same problem. can anyone help?

item.title: [PI] compiler wont work for me - windows 7 - laptop
item.dc:creator: @Mee0345 Mee0345
item.description:
@Mee0345 wrote:

@echo off Title My Compiler Which Mee0345 improved "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.7.0_3\bin\javac.exe" -d ./Class/ Java/*.java Java/sign/*.java pause
That code should work on all windows computers, unless your jdk version is different ofcourse.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] compiler wont work for me - windows 7 - laptop
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“whackatre, post:8, topic:435703”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=538424.msg3939365#msg3939365 date=1331293352]
@whack, if he has jdk he has javac simples o.o
[/quote]

My question was whether the path was correct. Of course JDK has javac.exe. Lol.[/quote]
ah right yeah, sorry your question was clearly right. My mistake, i misread it

item.title: [PI] compiler wont work for me - windows 7 - laptop
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:4, topic:435703”]jdk1.7.0_3 this is your jdk version, if not change it to the one your using (x86) this may not apply to your computer if not remove it. I have a 32bit and i don’t use the x86 thing in my compilers but on tv i know that 64bit computers have it so they can run 32bit programmes(I think)< i didn’t explain what im trying to say properly sorry hard to explain what im tryna say lol

@whack, javac.exe exists.[/quote]

How would you know that his specified path actually exists?
